meanings.definition: The quality of being deceitful or dishonest.
meanings.sent1: His fraudulence was evident in the way he lied about his qualifications.
meanings.sent2: The company's reputation was tarnished by the fraudulence of its CEO.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a touch of fraudulence to deceive the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fraudulence of the counterfeit products was exposed by the authorities.
meanings.sent5: The detective was determined to uncover the fraudulence behind the elaborate scheme.

meanings.definition: An act of deceiving or misrepresenting.
meanings.sent1: The fraudulence of the scheme was revealed when the truth came out.
meanings.sent2: She was caught in the act of fraudulence when she falsified the documents.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's humor had a hint of fraudulence that made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The fraudulence of the sales pitch made customers wary of the product.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was filled with fraudulence, aiming to mislead the public.
